newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's Sanyo to launch TV with Internet facility.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Sanyo to launch TV with Internet facility.

text.p: Japan's Sanyo Electric Co. said Monday it planned to launch next-generation television sets in Japan in October that can be used to surf the Internet.
The sets, which will come in 21-inch and 28-inch models, will allow users an initial 10 hours free access to the Internet via a service provider run by Sanyo, the company said.
Users can search Internet menus and exchange electronic mail on the right side of the TV screen while viewing TV programmes on the left side.
When surfing the Internet, commands are given via the TV remove control unit instead of a mouse.
The new products will be priced at 115,000 yen ($1,055) for the 21-inch model and 198,000 yen ($1,816) for the 28-inch model, Sanyo said.
Sanyo plans to make a combined 10,000 units a month, initially for the domestic market.
Sanyo is the third Japanese company to announce Internet TVs this year, following Mitsubishi Electric Corp. and Sharp Corp.
